review: I bought the Fire TV Stick, because I thought it would provide me with an easy, and portable, way to stream NETFLIX and view photograph albums.  Even though the Fire TV Stick is less than two feet from the WiFi router, when streaming NETFLIX, there's a regularly occurring hesitation in the playback; this doesn't occur when I use my ROKU box or when I use any of my DVD players that are capable of streaming NETFLIX.  The problem with viewing photograph albums is caused by the Amazon cloud; there is no easy way to arrange the photos for display.  The only choices are to display in order of file creation date or in the order of the date the pictures were taken.
